intro: Lasiandra gardneri, commonly known as the desert honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, featuring woody stems and small, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry climates. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Lasiandra gardneri is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging desert conditions.
